intro: Acmadenia apetala, commonly known as the flowerless acmadenia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Scrophulariaceae. It is native to Australia, specifically found in the southern regions of Western Australia and South Australia. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, usually inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as woodlands and heaths. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and often endangered species.
